text: [Music]
you got together earlier in the summer
to talk about debt generally and we've
had a bunch of project big projects that
we've all worked on together come out of
it especially with dad resistors
operations manual you're on a copy
[Music]
[Applause]
hi I'm Andrew Ross member of strike debt
and for those are those of us who've
been involved in the debt resistance
movement it's like debt it's everywhere
it's under your bed it's in the fridge
it's on the TV it's on Billboard's it's
you know lurking in dark alleyways the
impact of the debt economy is everywhere
in every aspect of our daily lives and
it's the primary channel through which
the 1% sucks revenue and extracts
profits from all of our daily activities
there are millions and millions of
people who are resisting debt by not
paying because they cannot pay it's a
form of debt resistance but it's an
isolated and anonymous form of debt
resistance if people suffer this in
isolation and they suffer the
consequences which is depression often
divorced sometimes suicide
the alternative is defaulting
collectively in the form of collective
debt resistance and the only way to do
that is come out in the open and
publicly empower yourself as a debtor
who will refuse to pay and what we
intend to do is raise a small amount of
money and buy a large amount of debt
it's possible to buy debt on the
secondary market banks will sell
defaulted loans on the secondary market
to collection agencies so for $5,000 we
could buy $100,000 worth of debt when we
do that we find out who the debtors are
and we write to them when we tell them
Occupy Wall Street has eliminated your
debt you're under no obligation to do
anything about this but if you'd like to
kick in some money to a fund then we can
bail out other debtors and eliminate
their debts so the idea is that people
will see the logic to this and we'll
contribute some funds and there will be
a rolling momentum
[Music]
